column5: Heading up to LDML in a couple of weeks. A friend just came back with a motor messed up from a rock. He's been going there for 20 years and just now found it. I have heard of a map available with FPS coordinates on it. Can anyone help me?
I'll be at pine point also. Just hoping the weather holds and the fishing stays good. Ken

Sorry to about your buddys motor doyle. I've been going up there for 20yrs also,but I had a good teacher my dads been going up for 35yrs. Depending on the water level, sometimes you see rocks that ya never knew where there. I've dinged a prop or 2 trolling in new water up there. Its always an adventure.
Will be at Pine Point on Aug 1. Have heard the fishing has been good. Mostly fish for northern, but the walleye fishing last year was great. Hope to talk to some of you people when I get there.
What's the latest report on fishing? We will be headed there the 4th. Does any one want to share their "honey holes" ? thanks
Hi, I will be a first timer at Lac Des Mille Lacs, I was just wondering what the best bait is up there or if lures work best?? Thanks, John

I'LL be going up july 31st,when are you going? Most people up there use minnows on jigs or little joe spinners. I usually troll crankbaits.I don't catch as many but they run bigger and can also pick up a few pike too.Some of my best lures have been frenzy rattle baits, rapala size 13 blue,the big shad rap in perch.Hope this helps,Greg
Thank you for the help! I'm going up Aug. 7-14th. I happen to be an Illinoisian also. I've heard jigs work pretty good for the walleye. I just wanna make sure that we can catch some fish.

Hello again, I have another first-timer question, concerning the lakes around Lac Des Mille Lacs. My dad, my uncle, my grandmother, and I will be going up to the lake Aug. 7-14th. Along with our boat we will be bringing a canoe with us. I was wondering if anyone had information about fishing on the lakes in the surrounding area? If so please reply. Thanks, John
Just curious as to how the fishing has been lately, reply if you have anything. Thanks, John
I have a cabin on LDML. Was up last weekend (July 14-17) and the fishing was excellent. Fish seem to be in the 17 to 24 ft range and are hitting everything - spinners, raps, minnows and leeches.
We like to fish below the Western Radids! All I can say is, Walleye Fillet! lol FM

I've been following the reports and it sounds like fishing will be better than in june. I'm going up on july 31 for the week, just wondering what the latest activity is. Thank you kindly for any reports.

svenny, I'm going up on the 31st also. What resort are you staying at? we're staying at pine point. Sounds like the fishing is going to be pretty good. Seems like it has been getting better for us since the started the slot limit. Greg
Just wondering how the fishing has been.Will be up with my family June 25th.Bringing my mom for the first time.
Going up Sat. We will be at Lac Des Mille Lacs Lodge. Comeing back on the 16 so I can be no help. But I have heard fishing has been slow.
Was at Pine Point May 24th fishing was great, alot of small walleyes.Water temp was 50 degrees.Fished on east end of lake.

We were at Lac des Mille Lodge last 3 weekends did pretty good, getting better each week, water was in low 60's, fish were in 20' to 12' one 41" northern and one 28" walleye was caught, and put back to breed another day!:7
Fish Hook where are you staying?
I will be staying at Open Bay Lodge.
Caught several 20"to 27" walleyes,not to many northerns.We fished thursday thru sunday.
Fishhook we stay at lac des mille lodge fish alot down by rock bay and owl island I have a blue crestliner 1850 fish hawk, stop by and say hi if you see us. Mike C.
Mike,I will be in a Lund Explorer 1700 black,I will be fishing with my wife and she will be the one catching all the fish.Hope we meet.
Mike we fish by bull island alot plus we go to cushing lake cafe for a meal or two. Orv
